bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

div1.p: [Carter] describes Henry Rose Carter's attachment to the University of Virginia.

div1.head: Letter fragment from [Laura Armistead Carter], [n.d.]
div1.p:
-2-
work for which he nominated for the Nobel prize.

I regret that we have no photographs of Father at pres-
ent. He had an appointment to have some taken in March, but
contracted the grippe the day before and was just convalescent
when he went south in May. I hope he can have some taken for
you on his return to Baltimore, but do not know just when that
will be--October or November I expect.

As to a sketch of his life, I hope that the enclosed
editorial from the Southern Medical Journal for June 1915 will
fill your requirements, although I will gladly give you any
further information should you so desire.

I am sure that my Father thoroughly appreciates the
recognition of his work which his election to your Chapter
demonstrates. He has always been deeply attached to the Univer-
sity of Virginia where he feels he acquired those habits of
thought and that trend of mind which have enabled him to do that
part of the world's work which fell to his share as well as
was possible to him--i. e. with properly trained faculties.
It is needless to say that we, his family, also greatly appre-
ciate the honor you have conferred on him.

Hoping that the enclosures will prove satisfactory and
assuring you that I shall be very glad to do anything further
if necessary.
